item.title: Road closure?â€¦.? Really, 24th November
item.description:
Road closed platform housing. No need to close road over weekend. Xmas shoppers. Poor traffic management. Reinstate lights and use road asap. No other large developers do this chaos
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crossing audible sound too loud/soft problem, 24th November
item.description:

item.title: Speed Camera Sign going to Apperley needed for Enforcement, 23rd November
item.description:
Speed Camera Sign going to Apperley needed for Enforcement. David Holland confirm B4213 will now have the speed van on it. According I believe that a Camera Sign and Speed Sign is needed at this location to allow penalty notices to be (more) successfully prosecuted, to avoid technicalities.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4213, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Missing Sign for junction on Bend and 30mpg!, 23rd November
item.description:
The "Junction on the outside of a bend ahead" sign has long since disappeared, and sadly drivers at 50mpg OR MORE! regularly drive straight on to the Deerhurst Single Track Road not realising the main road bends left. If traffic is coming the other way there is NO TIME TO stop as the bend means YOU CANNOT see the mistake the onward traffic may have made!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4213, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Deerhurst Walton sign too small and misplaced - bent, 23rd November
item.description:
Deerhurst Walton sign too small and misplaced, on B4213. This sign needs to be suitable to inform 50mpg traffic that there is a road junction, especially in low light and at night. Also the Location means the sign is regularly hit by speeding vans and/or lorries.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4213, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign has been vandalised (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Recent damage to pavement causing uneven surface, 23rd November
item.description:
Pavement outside 47 Ravensgate Road is sunken and raised leading to a trip hazard. Pavement has been fully bearing weight of lorries.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Ravensgate Road, Cheltenham

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Holes dug out, 23rd November
item.description:
Holes appearing in grass which leaves the area quite dangerous for small children playing. Could cause a nasty accident. This area is frequently used as a pathway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Whitehouse Way, Cheltenham

item.title: Dangerous dugout areas, 23rd November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Lyndhurst Close, Cheltenham
